author: NewsWire
text: A U.S. official has alleged wrongdoing by U.S. spy chief Tulsi Gabbard in a complaint that is so highly classified it has sparked months of wrangling over how to share it with Congress, according to people familiar with the matter.
aiSummary: A whistleblower complaint alleging misconduct by the director of national intelligence has been withheld from Congress for months due to classification disputes and possible executive privilege claims, intensifying concerns over oversight and transparency. The case intersects with the Trump administration’s continued efforts to revisit the 2020 election and raises questions about whether national security secrecy is being used to delay or block congressional review.

replies.author: CivicsNerd
replies.text: TRANSLATION: Tulsi Gabbard is exposing actual vote fraud, and is close to exposing more, so us, and our friends are getting scared and need to do some misdirection.

replies.author: HistoryBuff
replies.text: More likely selling US intel to Russia.

replies.author: MilkshakeMan
replies.text: Literally all of us at home already know what it is, she is a Russia asset.

author: PoliticsDaily
text: Trump to close Kennedy Center for two years, amid falling ticket sales and a growing list of performer cancellations, sparking more controversy over DC venue
aiSummary: Trump’s plan to close the Kennedy Center for two years comes after months of artist boycotts and cancellations following his takeover of the venue’s board, leadership, and branding. While the administration frames the shutdown as a necessary overhaul of a “dilapidated” building, the center underwent a $250 million renovation and expansion as recently as 2019. Critics argue the closure shifts attention away from declining attendance, performer withdrawals, and governance disputes, raising questions about political control over national cultural institutions and the use of renovation claims to justify sweeping institutional resets.

replies.author: TruthGuard
replies.text: Trump wants to own every building in America and have his name on every bulding in America

replies.author: Watcher
replies.text: Trump closes Kennedy Center amidst declining visitation due to his marking the edifice with his own name. Trump believes in this way he can cover up the public rejection of his shameful desecration of a once popular and honorable memorial to JFK.

author: wowsomuchpolitics
text: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-Louisiana) said that he is “confident” he will have enough support from Republicans in the House conference to end the partial government shutdown by Tuesday.
aiSummary: The shutdown centers on funding for the Department of Homeland Security after a contentious ICE operation in Minneapolis, with Democrats refusing to advance DHS money unless agents face new constraints such as mandatory body cameras and judicial warrants. Speaker Mike Johnson says he can reopen the government by Tuesday but, with only a razor-thin GOP majority and little Democratic support, passage depends almost entirely on Republican unity and Trump’s backing. The standoff highlights how immigration enforcement policy—rather than overall spending levels—has become the recurring trigger for shutdowns under narrow House margins.

replies.author: Ant Hooper
replies.text: Don’t cave to the Left. Hold fast to what is right.

replies.author: Andreas
replies.text: Johnson is on the way out... Republicans are starting to run after the Texas loss on Saturday.

replies.author: JimBoot
replies.text: Mike Johnson's confidence in knowing what his caucus will do is as reliable as his confidence in knowing what unhinged nonsense Trump will post online at 2am on any given day.

author: USPolitics
text: A federal judge ruled that 5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos, detained by ICE alongside his father, should not remain in federal custody. Data and analysis suggest ICE is increasingly detaining young children amid President Trump’s mass deportation efforts.
aiSummary: A federal judge ordered the release of a five-year-old asylum-seeking child and his father after criticizing ICE’s enforcement tactics as driven by deportation quotas rather than humanitarian standards. The ruling follows national backlash over the child’s arrest, disputed claims that he was used to draw other family members out of the home, and broader scrutiny of child detention amid pending asylum cases.

replies.author: RFKStan
replies.text: I hope his family sues for every penny they can get. Poor kid. I hope he isn’t totally scarred for life from this experience

replies.author: Heritage83
